Detailed Description

HTTP request data structure.

HttpRequest holds header and entity that are used in http request. It provides method to define user's own header field. Following is a example of building a very simple usable HttpRequest 

 HttpRequest req("http://www.example.com/");

Member Function Documentation

bool gaia::net::HttpRequest::getHeader ( const gaia::base::String &  key,
gaia::base::String *  value 
) const

Get header of this request.

Can be used to test if a key exists. 

 if (req.getHeader(key, NULL) == NET_NOT_EXIST) {
   // Net exist
 }
Parameters:
keyName of the header field.
valueValue of this field, can be null if call is just want to test if this key existed.
Returns:
true if requested key exists.

Parameters:

Returns:
An error code.
RESULT gaia::net::HttpRequest::setEntity ( HttpEntity *  entity)

Set entity of request.

Entity will be sent to server in request's body. If entity had been set previously, the old one will be deleted.

Parameters:
entityHttp entity of this request. This function WILL TAKE OWNERSHIP of entity and WILL DELETE the instance after request is sent or another entity is set.
Returns:
An error code.
RESULT gaia::net::HttpRequest::setHeader ( const gaia::base::String &  key,
const gaia::base::String &  value 
)

Set a field of header.

Header may be override by HttpConnection or HttpClient. For Http Post request. When key-value pair is to be transported, content type must be set to "application/x-www-form-urlencoded".

Parameters:
keyName of the header field.
valueValue of the header field.
Returns:
An error code.
RESULT gaia::net::HttpRequest::setMethod ( const gaia::base::String &  method)

Set request method.

Parameters:
methodRequest method.
Returns:
An error code.
